intro: Erysimum ochroleucum, commonly known as the yellow heartleaf mustard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and yellow-green in color. Its flowers are small, bright yellow, and arranged in racemes, blooming from spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and disturbed areas.
